title: Keeners on Frappr
content:
For anyone who doesn't know, Frappr is an online map where people can post where they live. It is similar, in design, to Google maps. Well I thought it would be cool to set up one for Keeners.

[url=http://www.frappr.com/keeners]Check it out.[/url]

Come on, be a sport and put yourself down. It is free, quick and relatively painless. I already put myself down. Just click on my little marker on the map.

And could someone give an invitation to the people over at Keen:Modding? I never signed up there and I don't feel like doing it just to tell them about this.-----------------------
[img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/shikadimastercopy.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keeners on Frappr
content:
Cool, I found out this thing about a week ago, and was planning to start one here sometime. Well, seems you managed to do it first.

I'll join it when I have something picture drawn.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]

And, most if not everyone in K:M checks these forums as well. K:M really doesn't have place for this kind of topics, so I won't tell about it there. They can find it here.Eat your veggies!

title: w00t
content: I'm in.  Looks like I'm pretty far away from the 3 already in (Gal, Xtra, All)... but this is an excellent idea!

title: Done
content:
Ok, I added myself there. Instead of drawing anything completely fictional gargoid I drew somekind of picture of what I might looks if I were gargoid. The hair is part of my experimenting with the gargoid concept..

We need more members there, join!Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Keeners on Frappr
content:
Actually, thats kinda true; the early settler stories estimated the gap between them as about as wide as the english channel, there was even a war comic where Maori refugees swim across the tasman to escape pursuers. This wasn't due to ignorance, rather, the two countries were actually that close.

Then one day the mayor of Australia gathered all convicted felons, natives demanding their lands, people with IQ's less than 60, layabouts, drunks, unemployed and irish and said "Here, you lot can be New Zealanders." Then he dynamited NZ, setting it adrift, where it eventually foundered on a plate boundry, where it reamins today.

[quote]Quote:[hr]About a year ago I thought New Zealand was part of Europe, small country near Holland. I've always studied my maps well![hr][/quote]

You're thinking of the province of Zealand, from which New Zealand gets its name. Like Jersey and New Jersy, York and New York.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

-Levellord

title: Re: Keeners on Frappr
content:
Galaxieretter, are you the creator of this Frappr group?
If so, perhaps you'd like to log in again, as it seems there are some new features.

It's now possible for people to tell whether they're male of female, and it's possible to add places.
Not very useful; maybe you could add where Billy Blaze lives as a "place" for instance, but I figured I'd mention it anyway.
There could be more, I didn't check.

See [url=http://www.frappr.com/frohmania]Frohmania[/url] for an example.
(It's a group for [url=http://www.hlcomic.com/]Concerned[/url], a comic about Half-Life 2 with funnies and laughs and whatnot.)Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: hum
content: Is there any way to edit your info, after the fact?  Say I wanted to change the message I had, or say more features were added to Frappr after I made my addition.  Is there any way I can update?

title: Re: hum
content:
I figured I'd sign up an account when entering myself, so I did.
Useful too, since I could easily add myself to the Concerned group as well, no extra work involved.

Anyway, with an account it's possible to edit your personal information, as well as the shout out thingy you posted in any group.
I doubt it's possible if you posted "anonymously", since the software has no way to determine if you are really the original poster, and it can't just let everybody edit everything.
Ask the group's administrator to edit I suppose, or let him delete entirely, and re-add something yourself, I suppose.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Locations
content:
I added where Billy Blaze lives to the map, as well as where id, Apogee, and Softdisk are.

Then I figured the Vorticon Mothership had its 8 Tantalus rays pointed at places on Earth, so I added those as well.
This way we can check who would've been dead the soonest when a specific ray was fired.
It doesn't seem like I'd be a winner for any of the rays.

(I always thought having 8 whole rays while 1 is sufficient is overredundant, but 8 is just a cool number I suppose.)

This Frappr thing is sort of funny, so maybe it should be added to the header on the PCKF?
That way more fans might sign themselves up there; right now we have 33.

About that header, wouldn't it make more sense to have the guidelines tip/warning at the top?
Then after that it would be a straight list of websites.
Of course this board belongs to CC314, so in that way it's the most "official", but... whatever.

title: Re: Locations
content:
*sigh* Did you ever play Keen 2? When Earth is shot by only one ray,it explodes into lots of large chunks; very damaging chunks too; what you don't see is them smashing into the Vorticon ship, smashing it into billions of pieces, with the death of all on board.

Unless all eight fire at once, the Earth is not totally vapourised, and the Vorticon ship is in danger.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Locations
content: Strange that they still only fire one ray even when Keen's out of the picture...

title: Re: Locations
content:
LL's description actually makes sense, but like Spleen mentions, when the Vorticons destroy Earth themselves, it doesn't seem like they're using any more firepower.

Looking at the map, the targets don't seem like particularly tactical ones either.
It's probably some sort of taunting thing, destroying monuments, important buildings and the like first, although there won't be a whole lot of time for anyone down there to be insulted or anything anyway.

If 1 shot is enough to break the planet, I doubt it matters much where you hit exactly.
Also the North American and European targets are pretty close, even to each other, but Sydney is quite a bit away from those.
N America is closest from the mothership, so both Europe and Sydney would need a little curving to the trajectory, but of course the Tantalus rays are quite capable of that.

So... what was this thread about?
Oh yeah, Frappr... anything else to add?
David A. Palmer Productions perhaps, but that barely even feels Keen-related.Retodon8
Sheep happens!
[url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

Mort: NO! I said fire on washington!
